thread.title: Report: MLB to decide if top Cuban prospect goes to Giants
thread.title_full: Report: MLB to decide if top Cuban prospect goes to Giants

author: Henry Schulman
title: Report: MLB to decide if top Cuban prospect goes to Giants
text:
Report: MLB to decide if top Cuban prospect goes to Giants San Francisco Chronicle 15 hrs ago By Henry Schulman Â© Jeff Chiu, Associated Press During this press availabililty on Oct. 5, Giants general manager Bobby Evans said he hoped to conclude a deal with Cuban prospect Eddy Julio Martinez As the Giants' season ended, word leaked they had agreed to terms with Cuban outfield prospect Eddy Julio Martinez for a $2.5 million bonus. It seemed like a nice international signing for the Giants. Martinez, 20, has been likened in body type to former Braves outfielder Andruw Jones, who had a successful major-league career.
AdChoices General manager Bobby Evans even said the day after the season ended that he hoped to get Martinez's signature on a contract soon.
Now, it appears Major League Baseball will decide if Martinez really does belong to the Giants.
According to this story by Jon Heyman of CBSSports.com , baseball officials will rule whether Martinez had a binding deal with the Giants, despite word that Martinez and his representatives had backed out of a verbal agreement to sign for $500,000 more with the Cubs.
One complicating factor, Heyman said, is that Martinez appears to have more than one representative speaking for him in addition to his agents in the United States, the well-regarded Beverly Hills Sports Council.
Heyman reported that baseball hopes to resolve the issue as early as this week.
Henry Schulman is a San Francisco Chronicle staff writer. E-mail: hschulman@sfchronicle.com
